g.text: and moisture-stable and no decomposition was observed even after
several months. Under the same experimental conditions, we grew
diﬀerent batches of crystals, which indicated the reproducibility of the
method. Several crystals were separated for further characterizations.
Single-crystal XRD data were collected by a
Rigaku AFC7 diﬀractometer with a Saturn 724 + CCD detector and
with the OrientExpress software. The compositions of the compound
were characterized by scanning electron microscopy
persive X-ray analysis (EDAX) and chemical analysis. The
composition obtained from the EDAX analysis is 41% Mn, 30% Pt,
and 29% Sn, and the composition obtained from chemical analysis is
, which are very close to the compositions obtained
56 mg) was performed using the NETZSCH
DSC 404C instrument. Magnetic properties were measured in
SQUID VSM (Quantum Design). The magnetic measurements
were performed in the temperature range of 2
)7 to (+)7 T. The electrical resistivity was
measured from 2 to 400 K in a Physical Property Measurement

PtSn; polarized light optical micrograph of
PtSn; single crystal ﬁgure of Mn
patterns in diﬀerent crystallographic directions; compo-
sition by chemical analysis; magnetization versus
temperature at various applied magnetic ﬁeld; aniso-
tropic displacement parameters; and bond lengths for
